Description of the Book Manuscript and Verification of its Attribution. The manuscript of this book is considered one of the very rare manuscripts, and by the grace and generosity of Allah, we were able to find it, so praise and thanks be to Him. This manuscript consists of (6) folios, meaning (12) pages, size 14x19 cm, and the manuscript is located under number (2187), under the code (Hadith) on microfilm (48606). This manuscript reached us with a chain of transmission (Isnad) back to the author, may Allah have mercy on him, and by studying this Isnad as shown at the beginning of the book, we find that the Isnad is authentic to the author. It has been read and heard by eminent scholars throughout ages and times. In the year 668 AH, the virtuous Sheikh Al-Hasan bin Ali Al-Irbili read it to the Sheikh of the era and Imam of his time, Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Khalil, the grandson of Ibn Al-Ajami, who read it to the venerable Sheikh Muhammad bin Abi Umar Al-Maqdisi. And in the year 708 Hijri, other hearings were obtained on it as shown at the end of the book. I have seen the verification of this book after finishing my verification of it by Dr. Muhammad Al-Banna. To proceed: I have attempted to serve this book by verifying its chains of transmission, commenting on them, placing internal titles, providing biographies for its notable figures, and preparing its scientific indexes.

A Part Containing News of the Grammarians. Authored by Abu Tahir Abd al-Wahid bin Umar bin Muhammad bin Abi Hashim al-Muqri'. Narration of Abu al-Hasan Ali bin Ahmad bin Umar al-Hammami al-Muqri' from him. Narration of the Chamberlain Abu al-Hasan Ali bin Muhammad bin Ali bin al-Allaf al-Muqri' from him. Narration of Abu Muhammad Abdullah bin Ahmad al-Muqri' by license (Ijaza), and Abu Mansur bin Hibatullah al-Mawsili (1). And Abu al-Barakat Ahmad bin Abd al-Malik al-Zawghani by hearing from him. Narration of Abu al-Yumn Zaid bin al-Hasan bin Zaid al-Kindi from Abu Muhammad Abdullah bin Ali al-Muqri'. Narration of Abu Muhammad Abd al-Aziz bin al-Akhdar from Abu Muhammad Abdullah bin Mansur al-Mawsili (2). And narration of Abu al-Futuh Nasr bin Abi al-Faraj al-Husari from Abu al-Barakat al-Zawghani. Narration of Ibn al-Bukhari by hearing from al-Kindi, and by license from the others. Narration of Sheikh Salah al-Din Muhammad bin Abi Umar al-Maqdisi from him. Narration of the Sheikh of our Sheikh, Abu al-Wafa Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Khalil al-Halabi from him. Narration of our Sheikh Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Muhammad al-Salam from him. Narration of his scribe Hasan bin Ali bin Yusuf al-Irbili from him.

text: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful. And may Allah send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his family and grant them peace. The Musnid of the time, Salah al-Din Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Abi Umar al-Maqdisi informed us, saying: The Imam Sheikh, Musnid of Sham, Fakhr al-Din Abu al-Hasan Ali bin Ahmad bin Abd al-Da'im bin Ahmad al-Maqdisi informed us by reading to him while I was listening on Saturday, the seventeenth of Rabi' al-Akhir in the year six hundred and eighty-nine.

The Sheikhs Abu al-Yumn Zaid bin al-Hasan bin Zaid al-Kindi informed us by reading to him while I was listening, and the Hafizs Abu Muhammad Abd al-Aziz bin Mahmud bin al-Mubarak bin al-Akhdar and Abu al-Futuh Nasr bin Abi al-Faraj bin Ali al-Husari by license.

The first said: Abu Muhammad Abdullah bin Ali bin Ahmad al-Muqri' informed us. And the second said: Abu Muhammad Abdullah bin Mansur bin Hibatullah bin al-Mawsili informed us. And the third said: Abu al-Barakat Ahmad bin Abd al-Malik al-Buzghani informed us. They said: The Chamberlain Abu al-Hasan Ali bin Muhammad bin Ali bin al-Allaf al-Muqri' informed us. The Sheikh of al-Kindi, Abu Muhammad, said by license: Abu al-Hasan Ali bin Ahmad bin Umar bin Hafs informed us
Al-Hammami by reading to him while I was listening in the month of Rabi' al-Awwal in the year four hundred and sixteen. Abu Tahir Abd al-Wahid bin Umar bin Muhammad bin Abi Hashim al-Muqri' told us

[Hammam bin Yahya Warns Against Solecism] 1 - Abu Bakr Muhammad bin Ali bin Ismail al-Tawwazi told us, Umar bin Shabbah told us, Affan told us, saying: Hammam said: Whatever I narrated to you from Qatadah with solecism, correct its grammar, for Qatadah did not commit solecism.

[Sheikh al-Islam Hammad bin Salamah Warns Against Solecism] 2 - Abu Tahir told us, Abu Bakr told us, saying: Abu Zaid told us, Affan told us, Hammad bin Salamah told us: Whoever commits solecism does not narrate from me.

[From Strange Paradoxes] 3 - Abu Tahir told us, Abu Bakr told us, saying: Abu Zaid told us, Affan or Abu al-Walid told me: Yazid bin Abi Maryam used to use strange words when narrating from al-Hasan, and commit solecism when narrating from Ibn Sirin.

[The First to Establish Grammar] 4 - Abu Tahir told us, Muhammad told us, Umar told us, Abdullah bin Muhammad, meaning al-Tawwazi, told us, saying: I heard Abu Ubaidah say: The first to establish grammar was Abu al-Aswad al-Du'ali, then Maymun al-Aqran, then Anbasah al-Fil, then Abdullah bin Abi Ishaq. He said: And Isa bin Umar wrote two books on grammar, he named one 'Al-Jami'' (The Compiler) and the other 'Al-Mukammil' (The Completer). So the poet said: Grammar became invalid entirely ... Except what Isa bin Umar introduced. That is completion and this is a compilation ... So they are to people like the sun and the moon.

[The First to Establish Arabic] 5 - Abu Tahir told us, Muhammad told us, Umar bin Shabbah told us, Hayyan bin Bishr told us, Yahya bin Adam told us from Abu Bakr from Asim who said: The first to establish Arabic was Abu al-Aswad al-Du'ali. He came to Ziyad in Basra and said: I see that the Arabs have mixed with non-Arabs, so their tongues have changed. Do you permit me to establish speech for the Arabs by which they can parse and correct their speech? He said: No. He said: Then a man came to Ziyad and said: May Allah reform the Prince, our father died and left behind sons (banūna - incorrect grammar, should be banīna). He said: Call Abu al-Aswad for me. He said: Establish for the people that which I had forbidden you to establish for them.

[Two Liars Among the People of Kufa] 6 - Abu Tahir told us, Abu Bakr told us, Umar told us, Abu Bakr bin Khallad told us, saying: I heard Al-Mu'tamir bin Sulayman narrating from his father saying: The people of Kufa have two liars: Al-Suddi and Al-Kalbi.

[Recommendation to Correct the Tongue] 7 - Abu Zaid said: Al-Sha'bi entered the Mosque of Kufa while there were some clients (Mawali) teaching Arabic. He said to them: Correct your tongues, for it is you who have corrupted it.

[From the Virtues of Abu Amr bin al-Ala'] 8 - Abu Tahir told us, Abu Bakr told us, Ubaydullah bin Muhammad al-Yazidi told us, the nephew of Al-Asma'i told us from his uncle saying: Whenever I heard Abu Amr speaking, I thought he knew nothing well, yet he did not commit solecism, speaking in an easy manner.

[Ibn Umar Gets Angry at People of Solecism] 9 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad bin Ishaq al-Tanukhi told us, my father told me from Husayn al-Ju'fi from Abbad from Umar bin Nafi' from his father saying: There was a man beside Ibn Umar who committed solecism, so he sent to him: Either you move away from us or we will move away from you.

[Commander of the Faithful Umar bin al-Khattab Recommends Learning Arabic] 10 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad told us, my father told me, Zaid bin al-Hubab told us from Abd al-Warith Ibn Sa'id al-Anbari, Abu Muslim told me fifty years ago that Umar bin al-Khattab said: Learn Arabic, for it increases chivalry.

11 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad told us, my father told me, Zaid bin al-Hubab told me from Talha bin Yahya al-Madani, Ata told us, saying: It reached me that Umar bin al-Khattab heard a man speaking Persian during Tawaf, so he grabbed him by his upper arm and said: Seek a way to Arabic.

[Abu Bakr Fears Solecism] 12 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad told us, my father told us from Husayn al-Ju'fi from Abbad bin Kathir from Zakariya from al-Sha'bi saying: Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, said: To recite and omit is more beloved to me than to recite and commit solecism.
And Umar said: Whoever recites the Quran and parses it correctly and then dies, he will have with Allah on the Day of Resurrection the reward of a martyr.

[Raising Children Not to Commit Solecism] 13 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad told us, my father told me, Zaid bin al-Hubab told us from Abu al-Rabi' al-Samman from Amr bin Dinar saying: Ibn Umar and Ibn Abbas used to beat their children for solecism.

14 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad told us, my father told me, Mahbub bin al-Husayn told us from Abu Harun al-Ghanawi from Muslim bin Shaddad al-Laythi from Ubay bin Ka'b who said: Learn solecism in the Quran just as you learn the verses of the Quran.

15 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad told us, my father told me, Ishaq and Muhammad the sons of al-Tabba' told us from Hammad bin Zaid from Wasil the client of Abu Uyaynah from Yahya bin Aqil from Yahya bin Ya'mur from Ubay bin Ka'b who said: Learn Arabic in the Quran just as you learn its memorization.

[Knowledge of Quranic Parsing is Better Than Memorizing Its Letters] 16 - Abu Tahir told us, Ahmad told us, my father told us, Muhammad bin Isa and Malik Ibn Ismail told us from Sharik from Jabir from Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Yazid that Abu Bakr and Umar said: To memorize some parsing of the Quran is more beloved to us than memorizing some of its letters.

17 - Abu Tahir told us, Waki' bin Khalaf told us, Muhammad bin Khallad told me, saying: A man was heard saying to Abu Zaid: Do you suspect me regarding the religion of Allah? He said: I suspect you regarding the language of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him.

[From the Anecdotes of the Linguists] 18 - Abu Tahir told us, Waki' told us, Muhammad bin Khallad told me, Al-Walid Ibn Hisham al-Qahdhami told us, saying: Khalid bin Safwan entered the bathhouse and there was a man with his son. He wanted to show Khalid what eloquence he possessed, so he said: O my son, start with your hands (yadaka - nominative case, incorrect) and your legs (rijlaka - nominative case, incorrect). Then he turned to Khalid and said: O Abu Safwan, speech whose people have gone. He said: This is speech for which Allah has never created any people.

19 - Abu Tahir told us, Musa bin Ubaydullah told us, Ibn Abi Sa'd al-Warraq told us, Ahmad Ibn Umar bin Ismail told us from Abd al-Aziz al-Zuhri, Muhammad bin al-Harith al-Makhzumi told me saying: A man entered upon Abd al-Aziz bin Marwan complaining about an in-law of his. He said to him: My son-in-law (khatani) did such and such to me. Abd al-Aziz said to him: Who circumcised you (man khatanaka)? He said: My circumciser (khatani) is the circumciser who circumcises people.

Abd al-Aziz said to his scribe: Woe to you, what did he answer me with? He said to him: O Prince, you committed solecism, and he does not know solecism. You should have said to him: Who is your son-in-law (man khatanuka)? Abd al-Aziz said: I see myself speaking a language that the Arabs do not know. I will not meet people until I know solecism. He said: So he stayed in the house for a week not appearing, with someone teaching him Arabic. He said: Then he led the people in the Friday prayer, being one of the most eloquent people. He said: He used to give for Arabic and withhold for solecism, until visitors came to him from the people of Medina and the people of Mecca from Quraysh. He started saying to a man among them: Who are you from?

He would say: From Banu Fulan (tribe so-and-so). So he would say to the scribe: Give him two hundred dinars. Until a man from Banu Abd al-Dar bin Qusai came. He said: Who are you from? He said: From Banu Abd al-Dar (Banū - nominative, incorrect grammar, should be Banī). He said: You will find it in your reward. And he said to the scribe: Give him one hundred dinars.

[His Hair Turned Grey from Ascending the Pulpit] 20 - Abu Tahir told us, Musa told us, Ibn Abi Sa'd told us, Muhammad bin Ishaq al-Musayyibi told us, this Sheikh, meaning Abu Sufyan al-Kufi, told us from Ja'far bin Uqbah al-Hanzali saying: It was said to Abd al-Malik bin Marwan: Greying has hastened to you. He said: Frequent ascending of the pulpit and fear of solecism have greyed me.

[He Seeks Forgiveness from His Lord upon Solecism] 21 - Abu Tahir told us, Musa told us, Ibn Abi Sa'd told us, Ishaq bin Ibrahim bin Makhlad al-Marwazi told us, Al-Nadr bin Shumayl told us, Al-Khalil bin Ahmad told us, saying: Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani committed solecism in a letter, so he said: I seek forgiveness from Allah.
[From the Virtues of Al-Awza'i] 22 - Abu Tahir told us, Musa told us, Ibn Abi Sa'd told us, Al-Fadl told us, saying: Abu Mushir said: Al-Awza'i did not commit solecism.

[From the Anecdotes of a Student of Al-A'mash] 23 - Abu Tahir told us, Musa told us, Ibn Abi Sa'd told us, Ismail bin Ya'qub told us, Muhammad told us, Abu Abdullah al-Shaqantari told me saying: Ibrahim was reading to Al-A'mash, so he said {Qala Liman Hawlahu Ala Tastami'un} (He said to those around him: Do you not hear?) [using 'Liman' instead of 'Liman']. So Al-A'mash said to him: Liman Hawlahu? (To whom around him?). He said: Did you not tell me that 'Man' (who) makes what follows it genitive?

[The Best Poem in Praise of Grammar and Its People] 24 - Abu al-Tayyib Muhammad bin al-Husayn bin Humayd bin al-Rabi' recited to us, Abu al-Hasan Ali Ibn al-Harith al-Murhibi recited to me, Anbasah bin al-Nadr recited to us for Ali bin Hamza al-Kisa'i: Indeed, grammar is an analogy to be followed ... And in every matter, it is beneficial.

So if the youth sees grammar ... He passes through speech passingly and expands. Everyone who sat with him feared him ... From a speaking or listening companion. And if the youth does not see grammar ... He fears to speak out of cowardice and cuts off. So you see him install the nominative and what ... Was genitive and from accusative he raised. He reads the Quran not knowing what ... Parsing changes in it and makes. And the one who knows it reads it ... So if he doubts a letter he returns. Looking into it and its parsing ... So if he knows grammar he speaks openly. So they are equal in it according to you ... The Sunnah among us is not like innovations. How many lowly ones has grammar raised and how many ... A noble one we have seen it abase.

And praise be to Allah alone, and may Allah send blessings upon our master Muhammad and upon his family and companions and grant them peace. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds. To proceed, the unique virtuous Sheikh Badr al-Din al-Hasan bin Ali bin Yusuf al-Irbili by origin, read all of this part to me, its scribe, may Allah Almighty benefit by him through my reading of it to the Imam Sheikh Hafiz Burhan al-Din Abu al-Wafa Ibrahim bin Muhammad Khalil, grandson of Ibn al-Ajami al-Halabi, may Allah Almighty have mercy on him, through his reading of it to the majestic Sheikh, Musnid of the time, Salah al-Din Muhammad bin Abi Umar al-Maqdisi with his chain at its beginning. And that was authenticated and established on Tuesday [......] (1) ten of the month of Rabi' al-Akhir from the months of the year six hundred and sixty-eight. And I licensed him what is permissible for me and regarding me to narrate. Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Muhammad al-Salami al-Shafi'i said and wrote it, may Allah Almighty forgive him by His grace and generosity, and may Allah send blessings upon our master Muhammad and his family and companions and grant them peace.
foot_note: 1. What is between the brackets is a blank space in the original approximately the size of a word, and it was written in the margin: Perhaps it is 'fourth'.
